slides.title: Welcome to CMA Part 1A
slides.content:
# External Financial Reporting

Part 1A covers **financial reporting** under US GAAP.

## What You Will Learn

- **Financial Statements** - Structure and content
- **Recognition** - When to record
- **Measurement** - How to value
- **Disclosure** - What to report

## CMA Part 1 Overview

| Section | Weight |
|---------|--------|
| External Reporting | 15% |
| Planning & Analysis | 20% |
| Cost Management | 15% |
| Internal Controls | 15% |
| Technology & Analytics | 15% |
| Economics | 20% |

slides.title: Financial Statements
slides.content:
# Financial Statement Framework

## Primary Statements

| Statement | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Balance Sheet | Financial position |
| Income Statement | Performance |
| Statement of Cash Flows | Cash movements |
| Statement of Equity | Owner changes |

## Balance Sheet Format

```
Assets:
  Current assets
  Non-current assets

Liabilities:
  Current liabilities
  Long-term liabilities

Equity:
  Common stock
  Retained earnings
```

## Current vs Non-Current

| Current | Non-Current |
|---------|-------------|
| < 1 year | > 1 year |
| Operating cycle | Long-term |

slides.title: Income Statement
slides.content:
# Income Statement

## Single-Step Format

```
Revenues
- All expenses
= Net income
```

## Multi-Step Format

```
Revenue
- COGS
= Gross profit
- Operating expenses
= Operating income
+/- Other items
= Income before tax
- Tax
= Net income
```

## Comprehensive Income

| Item | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Net income | Through P&L |
| OCI items | Not through P&L |

## OCI Examples

- Unrealized gains on AFS
- Foreign currency translation
- Pension adjustments

slides.title: Revenue Recognition
slides.content:
# ASC 606 Revenue

## Five-Step Model

```
1. Identify contract
2. Identify performance obligations
3. Determine transaction price
4. Allocate to obligations
5. Recognize when satisfied
```

## Performance Obligations

| Type | Recognition |
|------|-------------|
| Point in time | On transfer |
| Over time | As progress |

## Variable Consideration

```
Constraint:
Only include if highly probable
no significant reversal
```

## Contract Costs

- Incremental costs: Capitalize
- Fulfillment costs: Capitalize if criteria met

slides.title: Inventory
slides.content:
# Inventory Accounting

## Cost Flow Methods

| Method | Effect |
|--------|--------|
| FIFO | Ending inventory = recent |
| LIFO | COGS = recent |
| Weighted Average | Smoothed |

## Lower of Cost or NRV

```
NRV = Selling price - Completion costs - Selling costs

If Cost > NRV: Write down
```

## LIFO Reserve

```
LIFO Reserve = FIFO Inventory - LIFO Inventory

Used to convert between methods
```

## Perpetual vs Periodic

| System | Updates |
|--------|--------|
| Perpetual | Continuous |
| Periodic | At period end |

slides.title: Long-Lived Assets
slides.content:
# PPE and Intangibles

## Initial Measurement

```
Purchase price
+ Directly attributable costs
+ Asset retirement obligation
= Initial cost
```

## Depreciation Methods

| Method | Pattern |
|--------|--------|
| Straight-line | Even |
| Declining balance | Accelerated |
| Units of production | Usage-based |

## Impairment (US GAAP)

```
Step 1: Recoverability test
(Carrying > Undiscounted cash flows?)

Step 2: Impairment loss
(Carrying - Fair value)
```

## Intangibles

| Type | Amortization |
|------|-------------|
| Finite life | Amortize |
| Indefinite life | Test for impairment |

slides.title: Leases
slides.content:
# ASC 842 Leases

## Lessee Accounting

| Lease Type | Treatment |
|------------|----------|
| Finance | Like ownership |
| Operating | Like rental |

## Recognition

```
All leases > 12 months:
- Right-of-use asset
- Lease liability
```

## Finance Lease

- Amortize ROU asset
- Interest on liability
- Front-loaded expense

## Operating Lease

- Single lease expense
- Straight-line pattern

slides.title: Income Taxes
slides.content:
# ASC 740 Income Taxes

## Current vs Deferred

| Type | Basis |
|------|-------|
| Current | Tax return |
| Deferred | Temporary differences |

## Deferred Tax

```
Deferred Tax = Temporary difference x Tax rate
```

## DTL vs DTA

| Type | Creates |
|------|--------|
| DTL | Future taxable > book |
| DTA | Future deductible > book |

## Valuation Allowance

```
If more likely than not
DTA won't be realized:
Record valuation allowance
```

slides.title: Pensions
slides.content:
# Pension Accounting

## Plan Types

| Type | Risk Bearer |
|------|-------------|
| Defined contribution | Employee |
| Defined benefit | Employer |

## Defined Benefit

```
Net liability = PBO - Fair value of assets
```

## Pension Cost Components

| In P&L | In OCI |
|--------|--------|
| Service cost | Actuarial gains/losses |
| Interest cost | Prior service cost |
| Return on assets | |

## Amortization

OCI items amortized to P&L using corridor approach.

slides.title: Equity Transactions
slides.content:
# Stockholders' Equity

## Stock Issuance

```
Dr Cash (proceeds)
Cr Common Stock (par)
Cr APIC (excess)
```

## Treasury Stock

| Method | Treatment |
|--------|----------|
| Cost | Dr Treasury at cost |
| Par | Dr Treasury at par |

## Stock Dividends

| Size | Charge to RE |
|------|-------------|
| Small (< 25%) | Fair value |
| Large (> 25%) | Par value |

## Stock Splits

No journal entry, adjust shares outstanding.

slides.title: Statement of Cash Flows
slides.content:
# Cash Flow Statement

## Three Sections

| Section | Activities |
|---------|------------|
| Operating | Trading |
| Investing | Assets |
| Financing | Capital |

## Indirect Method

```
Net income
+/- Non-cash items
+/- Working capital changes
= Cash from operations
```

## Non-Cash Adjustments

- Depreciation (add)
- Gains on sale (subtract)
- Losses on sale (add)
- Increase in receivables (subtract)
- Increase in payables (add)

slides.title: Cash Flow Quiz

slides.title: Earnings Per Share
slides.content:
# EPS Calculation

## Basic EPS

```
Basic EPS = (Net income - Preferred dividends) /
            Weighted average shares
```

## Diluted EPS

```
Adjust for:
- Convertible securities
- Options (treasury stock method)
- Contingent shares
```

## Treasury Stock Method

```
Additional shares =
Options exercisable
- Shares that could be repurchased
  at average market price
```

## Antidilutive

Exclude if would increase EPS.

slides.title: Fair Value
slides.content:
# Fair Value Measurement

## Definition

Exit price in orderly transaction.

## Fair Value Hierarchy

| Level | Inputs |
|-------|--------|
| 1 | Quoted prices |
| 2 | Observable |
| 3 | Unobservable |

## Most Common Uses

- Financial instruments
- Impairment testing
- Business combinations

## Disclosure

- Fair value by level
- Transfers between levels
- Level 3 reconciliation
